user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of named_thread_starter:
```c
static MHD_THRD_RTRN_TYPE_ MHD_THRD_CALL_SPEC_
named_thread_starter (void *data)
{
  struct MHD_named_helper_param_ *const param =
    (struct MHD_named_helper_param_ *) data;
  void *arg;
  MHD_THREAD_START_ROUTINE_ thr_func;

  if (NULL == data)
    return (MHD_THRD_RTRN_TYPE_) 0;

  MHD_set_cur_thread_name_ (param->name);

  arg = param->arg;
  thr_func = param->start_routine;
  free (data);

  return thr_func (arg);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
return (MHD_THRD_RTRN_TYPE_) 0;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 1.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 violation found: the fragment performs a plain cast of the integer constant 0 to the type MHD_THRD_RTRN_TYPE_. This is standard C usage. There is no evidence in the fragment of any compiler-specific language extension. (If MHD_THRD_RTRN_TYPE_ were itself defined using a documented compiler extension, that definition — not this cast — would be the violation.)
